title: SEC Probes An AIG Unit’s Sales Of Annuities To Teachers
text:
The annuities business, which has been struggling to polish its image in recent years, is getting an unwanted spotlight for questionable sales practices by a major provider of annuities to teachers.

The Securities and Exchange Commission has opened an investigation into Valic, a subsidiary of the insurance behemoth AIG, to determine if agents were properly disclosing costs and fee structures, and whether they were given financial incentives to sell annuities over lower-cost mutual funds, according to a Wall Street Journal...
description: Valic, a subsidiary of AIG, may have improperly sold annuities to teachers via their 403(b) plans. The Securities and Exchange Commission is investigating disclosures around cost and fee structure, and whether sales people were incentivized to sell annuities over lower-cost mutual funds.
